HostA: Facebook, though—they lost nearly $60 billion last year, but still came in third? That just seems counterintuitive.
HostB: Well, their market cap is actually super small compared to others—only around $927 million at the end of that period.
HostA: Meanwhile, Berkshire Hathaway jumped 11 spots this year thanks to that Kraft Heinz acquisition.
HostB: Warren Buffett’s company is now 12th, which is a huge climb from where they were.
HostA: And then you’ve got Citigroup, which was number one in 2018 but fell all the way to seventh.
